result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Instructions on How to Appear Remotely

10:36 AM Defendant Jesus M. Rodriguez Hamilton appeared by ZOOM, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr appeared by ZOOM for Jesus M. Rodriguez Hamilton.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter James Larson appears by ZOOM.
Court calls case.
Interpreter sworn in.
Court reviews request from Deft regarding a Spanish speaking attorney.
Court explains the process of attorney appointment - not all are able to represent on felony cases.
Court has spoken to Marinette County and received approval for Atty Skorr to hire an interpreter for any meetings with the Deft and include on her billing.
Atty Skorr heard - her request was not necessarily only for the purpose of an interpreter, but asks Deft to confirm if he would like her to stay on the case.
Court speaks to Deft.
Deft heard - has never been able to communicate with Atty Skorr because of language differences.
Court speaks to all parties.
Court reviews process moving forward.
DA heard and agrees with the Court.
Atty Skorr heard - has all of the discovery, but there is a lot to review with the Deft.
Deft heard and requests documents to be in Spanish.
Court explains that most forms are only provided in English.
Court schedules with parties.
Interpreter to be present for the next hearing.
10:50 AM
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Letter from Defts brother

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: with conditions

1:29 PM Defendant Jesus M. Rodriguez Hamilton appeared by ZOOM, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter appears by ZOOM means.
Court calls case.
Interpreter, Susan Rascon, sworn in.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Hansen heard - has not had a chance to review charges with deft.
Deft does not qualify for PD.
Atty Hansen present for bond purposes only.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Hansen heard on bond.
Court imposes $50,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today and including THC w/o a valid Rx, surrender any passports, must be equipped with a GPS monitoring device before being released from the Jail, may travel from Marinette County through Oconto County to Green bay to attend to his child, if child is hospitalized deft may attend to the hospital where child is otherwise deft may not leave Marinette County for any reason, no contact with A.W. or any other known illegal drug users. 
1:59 PM off record.
2:02 PM back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms the date and time works with her schedule.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard.
Atty Hansen heard - will go over the dean paperwork with deft and his family.
Court reviews dean process with deft.
Deft understands.
Court addresses Deft's family that is present in the courtroom.
2:17 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
